Her all-around achievements and unwavering commitment have propelled our society to new heights. Shrinjal's ability to navigate complex discussions with grace and insight fosters an environment of intellectual growth and creativity.Join us on this enlightening journey guided by her multifaceted leadership, lighting the way to greatness.

We are thrilled to introduce Shubham Rawat, our senior advisor, whose wisdom, calm demeanor, and analytical skills shine brightly.As the former president of The Jaypee Debsoc for the 2023-24 term, Shubham has led our society to new heights with steadfast commitment. His poise in challenging situations and adept handling of debates encourage us to explore critical thinking and logical analysis deeply. His precise organizational skills ensure our events run smoothly, creating an atmosphere where ideas flourish and intellectual growth is nurtured.Join us on this enlightening journey guided by his insightful leadership, lighting the way to greatness.

We are delighted to introduce Radhika Jangra, our senior advisor, whose lively spirit and unwavering commitment have been a driving force behind our success.As the former Chief of Execution at Parola, the literary hub of JIIT, Radhika's vibrant energy and dedication have significantly contributed to our community. Her meticulous execution of events and infectious enthusiasm have created a dynamic environment where creativity and intellectual exploration thrive.Join us on this inspiring journey under her spirited leadership, lighting the way to greatness.

Tribute to Our General Secretary, Yashvardhan Jain !For the past two years, our esteemed general secretary has been the driving force behind our debating society. His unmatched managerial skills have steered us through countless successful debates, leaving an indelible mark on our community.But it’s not just about debates. Our general secretary’s passion for politics and history sets him apart. When he speaks, it’s like opening a time capsule—bridging the past with the present. His insights into historical events and political theories enrich our discussions, adding depth and perspective that only true enthusiasts can provide.As a mentor, he embodies understanding and compassion. Always ready to lend a helping hand, he guides us with wisdom and patience. His presence in our society is akin to salt in food—subtle yet essential. We owe our unwavering enthusiasm for excellence to their inspiring leadership.So, let’s embark on this transformative journey together. Let our general secretary’s mentorship unlock our true potential, as we explore the realms of politics, history, and spirited debates. 🌟

We are thrilled to introduce our esteemed President, Shubhranshi Agarwal, a beacon of dedication, leadership, and intellectual prowess at the Jaypee Debsoc!From achieving her first open break in her debut Hindi Parliamentary Debate to leading by example, Shubhranshi has consistently showcased her exceptional debating skills and unwavering commitment to excellence. Her passion for philosophy and psychology, combined with her deep love for literature and mastery of all debating formats, makes her an inspiring figure for all of us.Shaping "The New Jaypee Debsoc," Shubhranshi stands as one of the most creative individuals our society has ever seen. With a diverse knowledge spanning from management to digital spheres, she has proven herself in every debating arena. Her fiery speeches in both APDs and Hindi PDs have provided invaluable lessons to all juniors. She has always fought for the society and continues to do so with relentless dedication. As one of the most iconic figures of our Debsoc, Madam President leads our team towards future success and beyond.Join us in celebrating Shubhranshi's journey and her incredible contributions to the Jaypee Debsoc. Together, let’s continue to strive for excellence and intellectual growth under her exemplary leadership! 🚀✨

We are thrilled to introduce our Vice President, Priyanshu Baswala, a wanna be human, who is looking for strategic insight, and has lost all unwavering enthusiasm.Serving as our mentor for the 2023-24 tenure, Priyanshu brings vibrant energy to the Debating Society, inspiring us all to achieve exceptional feats. His expertise in conducting Asian Parliamentary Debate (APD) mocks has sharpened our skills and prepared us for competitive excellence. Priyanshu's knack for teaching philosophy in an engaging and comprehensible manner has forced us to learn oursleves which then broadened our intellectual horizons and deepened our understanding of complex concepts.His penchant for posing intriguing questions constantly challenges us to think.Priyanshu's unique perspective in debates, driven by his critical thinking and curiosity, has taught us to think outside the box. From coaching us in debates to helping with time management and coding he has been a role model for many. The "winner gets the Dairy Milk" contests and unique debates he has organized have ignited our passion for debating.Join us on this exciting journey where we will eat icecream and learn.

🎙 Mark your calendars! 🗓️ NSS JIIT and Parola are set to ignite the stage with a captivating debate competition on Martyrs' Day, January 20th, 2024. 🤝 This collaboration promises an intellectual showdown like never before!🌐 Embrace the power of dialogue as participants delve into pressing issues, offering insightful perspectives and engaging arguments. 🤔💬 Join us on this journey of intellectual exploration!🗣️ The stage is set, the minds are sharp, and Martyrs' Day becomes the canvas for a spirited exchange of ideas. 🎤🔥 Let the rhetoric unfold, as we commemorate the day with meaningful discussions that honor the sacrifices of our heroes.🗓️ 20th January 2024⏰ 11:00 AM Onwards📍 G9👥 Save the date, tag your debate enthusiasts, and be part of this fusion of minds! 🌟 #Debate #MartyrsDayCommemoration #intellectualshowdown

"The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand." — Vince LombardiToday, Parola celebrates our Senior Advisor Rika Verma's incredible achievement as she embarks on her new journey 🚀 Her hard work and dedication have paid off, and as the former President of Jaypee Debsoc, she has not only excelled scholastically but also demonstrated exceptional leadership.Her placement in KPMG comes as no surprise, a testament to her skills and potential. PART FIFTEEN: THE FUTURE AHEAD(THE HUMANITARIAN CRISIS, POWER STRUGGLE AND INTERNAL MILITANCY)In the final part of the series, we have thrown light on the future of Afghanistan with emphasis to Taliban regime, terrorism and the current global scenario.#The #afghan #Plight#The #future #ahead#The #humanitarian #crisis#power #struggle#internal #militancy

PART FOURTEEN: TAJISKISTAN AND TALIBAN(IS TAJIKISTAN THE MESSIAH OF TAJIKS?)Tajikistan has been apprehensive of the Taliban regime due to variety of reasons among which the fate of tajiks community is the most substantial.#the #afghan #plight#tajikistan #and #taliban#tajikistan#tajiks#uzbeks

“Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.” -Napoleon HillParola stands proud and feels immense pleasure to announce that our Former Director of Parola, Gautam Kumar has proved these words by bagging a placement at Magicpin.✨Since his 1st year being a member of  The Jaypee Debsoc and further in 2nd year the MUN secretary, by winning countless debates and MUNs he has successfully fostered a sense of belonging and camaraderie among young debators and many literary enthusiasts. His meticulous attention to detail, strategic planning ensured our organisation thrived and flourished. Warmest congratulations on securing this role! His determination and commitment has led him to this wonderful new path.Parola wishes him a very best for his glorious future ahead!🔥#NewBeginnings #CareerSuccess#JobPlacement #NextChapter #CareerJourney #joustjiit #AchievementUnlocked #TheJoust2023

"Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do."- PeleParola is elated to share that with his constant endeavor to explore, learn and improve, Amish Mishra, the former Head of Public Relations, has bagged a placement at Oracle.✨His success isn't just an achievement; it's a testament to his resilience and determination since his days as English PD Secretary at The Jaypee Debsoc. He won many competitions and has taught countless minds about different domains like his expertise -finance & trading. Parola bursting with pride congratulates him on this new path and luck for his future ventures.#NewBeginnings #CareerSuccess#JobPlacement #NextChapter #CareerJourney #joustjiit #TheJoust2023 #AchievementUnlocked

PART THIRTEEN: INDIA, TERRORISM AND TALIBAN(DIPLOMACY, CHINA AND IMMIGRATION)Given the circumstances in Afghanistan, India has to take concrete steps to make sure Terrorism does not find its way to grow.#the #afghan #plight#india #terrorism #taliban#diplomacy #china #immigration

PART TWELVE: ETHNICITY AND EXTENSION(END OF CIVILISATION?)Last Hindu priest refuses to abandon Afghanistan ancestral temple, says 'will consider it Seva even if Taliban kills me.'Pandit Rajesh Kumar, the last Hindu priest of the Rattan Nath temple, has decided not to leave the country despite being offered help.Since Afghanistan is no more a safe space for religious minorities, Taliban's capture of Afghanistan is considered as the end of longest civilization which had its roots connected to Hinduism.#the #afghan #plight#ethnicity #and #extinction#end_of_civilisation#saveminorities#hindus#tajiks#shia#uzbeks#hazaras#christians#tribals#uyghurs

PART ELEVEN: WOMEN AND SEXUAL GENDER MINORITIES (SILENCE OR DIE)Women rights and reforms were appreciated when the country was under the influence of the communists actors, but severely deteriorated when Taliban took over the Afghanistan due to the harsh implementation of the Sharia. As far as gender minorities are concerned, Afghanistan was never and most probably even in the future will be a place for them.#the #afghan #plight#women #and #sexual #gender #minorities#silence_or_die#women_rights#LGBTQIA+#staysafe#feelsafe #equality

PART TEN: THE PANJSHIR RESISTANCE (THE NEW MUJAHIDEEN...?)The Panjshir valley resistance developed soon after the Taliban took over the Afghanistan under the leadership of Ahmad Massoud and Vice President Amrullah Saleh against Taliban Regime. It is believed that it is still not under Taliban control.#The #panjshir #resistance#The #new #Mujahideen#The #Afghan #plight

PART NINE: US WITHDRAWAL AND TALIBAN AGAIN(TALIBAN '2.0' OR TALIBAN '1.0' AGAIN?)Joe Biden's ascension to Prime minister led to change in Afghan Policy by announcing withdrawal of American Troops by 9/11/21 paving the way for Taliban to recapture Afghan Land and leaving the country in a state of turmoil. Withdrawal of foreign forces from Afghanistan caused the death of so-called democracy and human rights in Afghanistan and potential rise of radical terrorism in the region.#US #withdrawal #and #Taliban #Again#Taliban2.0 #or #Taliban1.0 #Again#humanrights #democracy #afghanistan #peace #women #children #saynototerrorism

PART EIGHT: US WAR ON TERROR AND MISSION DEMOCRACY(RECONSTRUCTION)After 9/11, US declared war on Taliban in Afghanistan to get Osama Bin Laden without any concrete strategy for the same. US and her NATO allies seeked to reconstruct the Afghan land by introducing Democratic reforms for everyone.#us #war #on #terror #and #mission #democracy#reconstruction

PART SEVEN: TALIBAN AND 9/11 ATTACKS(JIHAD, AL- QAEDA AND TERRORISM)Here, The Jaypee Debsoc analyzed the conditions of the Afghanistan after the Taliban takeover. It also resulted in increase of terrorism in the region especially Pakistan and India. It also covers how 9/11 attacks brought an end to Taliban 1.0 regime.#Taliban #And #9/11 #Attacks#Jihad #AlQaeda #Terrorism#neverforgetneverforgive#noterrorism #peace #saynototerrorism #osamabinladen #afghanistan #America #GeorgeBush #Obama

PART SIX: AFGHAN CIVIL WAR (1992-1996)(MUJAHEDEEN WARLARDS TURN AGAINST EACH OTHER)This part of The Afghan Plight series focuses on the second part of the civil war which started in 1992 when the Najibullah communist regime began to crumble and USSR dissolved finally. This civil war covers the rivalries between the different Mujahideen factions which paved the way for Taliban to takeover the Afghan Land.#Afghan #civil #war #1992 #1996#Mujahedeen #warlords #turn #against #each #other

PART FIVE: AFGHAN CIVIL WAR (1989-1992)(DISSOLUTION OF USSR AND DEATH OF DREAM OF ISLAMIC SOCIALISM)Here we analyzed how the weakening of USSR brought an eventual death to the communist regime in the Afghanistan and how it led to the rise of Mujahedeen Warlords in the country. #afghan #civil #war #1989 #1992#dissolution #of #ussr #and #death #of #dream #of #islamic #socialism

PART FOUR: SOVIET INVASION OF AFGHANISTAN (1979- 1989)(COLD WAR, PROXY WAR AND THE MUJAHEDEEN)Here in this part of the timeline, we have covered about the details of Soviet Afghan War which was a result of Cold war and USSR trying to increase its influence over the Afghan land to access its rich mineral resources. This led to the rise of strong anti- soviet sentiments in the country which were backed up by the USA and subsequently the western block and other Middle East Islamic nations converting the whole region into a site of proxy war. And finally, we have covered how Jihad emerged against Soviet in the form of Mujahedeen warlords.#The #Afghan #Plight#Soviet #Invasion #of #Afghanistan#Cold #War #Proxy #War #Mujahedeen

PART 3: AFGHAN- SOVIET RELATIONS (INTERSECTION OF ISLAM AND COMMUNISM)Here we have thrown light on how the Afghan Soviet relations grew post the Third Anglo Afghan War which resulted in socialist reforms in the country and participation of women in the public domain. These reforms were not really appreciated by the Islamic fundamentalists and especially in the eastern and south- eastern parts of the country.#The #Afghan #Plight#Afghan #Soviet #Relations#Intersection #Of #Islam #And #Communism

Representation comes through varied sources and medium. June may come to an end, but Pride is forever and it's time to make our bookshelf and OTT watchlist to be more inclusive and inclined to the actual social reality. The Jaypee Debsoc has tried to come up with some different recommendations in Queer media- literature, Cinema and OTT which are actually free from all the queerbating and pinkwashing agendas as portrayed in Teen dramas, Spanish shows, Mexican Shows and other English shows. Again this list is inexhaustible and we would love to have more recommendations mentioned in the comment section.FICTION RECOMMENDATIONS-DreamBoy by Jim Grimsley-Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic by Alison Bechdel-Giovanni's room by James Baldwin-Maurice by E.M. Foster-As meat loves salt by Maria McCann-Less by Andrew Sean GreerNON-FICTION RECOMMENDATIONS-All boys aren't blue by George M. Johnson-Epistemology of the Closet (1990)-Between Men: English Literature and Male Homosocial Desire (1985)FILM AND TV SERIES RECOMMENDATIONS-J Edgar-The Imitation Game (2014)-Carol (2015)-Downtown Abbey-Sense 8

Leadership is not about the position, but the ability to inspire and bring out the best in others." 🌟✨ Step into the realm of intellectual excellence as we proudly introduce our esteemed President- Shubham Rawat, a beacon of knowledge, composure, and analytical prowess. Introducing The Jaypee Debsoc Secretariat, a formidable team of individuals who possess a wealth of knowledge and expertise in their respective fields. Together, they form an exceptional group comprising the English Secretaries, Rudroneel Sengupta and Medha Saxena, the Hindi Secretaries, Shubhranshri Aggarwal and Yash Jain, the MUN Secretaries, Faisal Shafique and Kunal Singh, and the Management Secretary, Chetan Singh.Each member of the Secretariat brings their unique skill set and diverse background, making them well-versed not only in their own domains but also in other fields. This collective brilliance will propel The Jaypee Debsoc to great heights, fostering new and inclusive discussions, thoughts, and ideas. The Secretariat's ability to engage in complex and nuanced conversations will enrich our society, ensuring that we tackle a wide range of topics with depth and understanding.The English Secretaries, Rudroneel Sengupta and Medha Saxena, possess exceptional communication skills and a keen understanding of language and rhetoric. Agenda: Hustle between Morals and Ethics in different scenariosMorals are what we act as an individual or human, whereas acts of ethics are defined by the profession of an individual. We as humans often come across various scenarios where we have to make tough decisions between our morals and our ethics. Even though we all were in fest mode, the debating attitude of curiosity and speaking was as high as expected from the debating. Even though it was a Fun activity, we all had a very active, enthusiastic and healthy discussions on the certain scenarios and the outcomes of this activity were:We became more empathetic toward people belonging to different professions and situations.We improvise on our critical thinking and expanding the horizon of debating.We interact with each other with more logical assertions followed by justifications and examples as well.

Model United Nations- an educational simulation for students to learn cooperation and diplomacy.  A very important session taken today, explaining the proceedings of an MUN from start till end.

Date: 13-Feb-2023Agenda : "How does money work and do we really need it?” This wasn't some conventional interactive meeting this time at G7. It was way beyond that. Infact it was a simulation of the Banking system of the United States Of America where the room was divided into 4 portions Federal Reserve, Private Bank Morgan Stanley, Private Corporations like Microsoft and General Public to understand the most important concept - Financial literacy which is indeed the need of the hour for youth today. This meet provides the description for monetary and financial functioning of a country and globe. What is exactly money, how does it work, who creates it and do we really need it. Why rich gets richer and poor gets poorer? By looking for answers to such questions we are able to understand various economic concepts with more relatable and relevant case studies of United States of America, India and Japan.

South Korea has quietly become Hollywood’s biggest competitor, churning out wildly popular music, TV dramas, and beauty and fashion trends with global appeal. K-dramas are generally known for having high production value, intense and often engrossing storylines, and quality acting that helps build an emotional connection between the characters and the audience. At the same time, the bold and skilful storytelling with which K-dramas tackle societal issues, personal struggles, and universal themes such as family, friendship, and love make for thoughtful content that resonates with audiences across geographical borders. So in this Blog The Jaypee DebSoc has analysed the reasons for the popularity of the K- Dramas and listed some of the popular K dramas right now. Do comment your favourite shows. https://thejaypeedebsoc.wordpress.com/2023/02/14/soft-power-of-k-dramas/Happy Reading.

Date: 06-02-2023Agenda of the Meeting: "Will a liberal world be a better world?"This meeting was not some conventional Right vs Left vs Centre. Rather it revolves around how all these are manifestations of the human response to change in society and how these ideologies in reality are subject to interpretation and have varied definitions. With valuable inputs from Madam President, Senior Advisor of Parola, Strategic Advisor of Parola and most importantly from the freshies and second years, we understand the problem statement with contextual examples of United States of America, India, Nazism and Communist USSR.

Swami Vivekananda, a spiritual genius with a commanding intellect and strength, crammed a lot of work and accomplishment into his brief life . Vivekananda, was enamoured with the agnostic Western schools of philosophy as a young man."The greatest sin is to think yourself weak."He believed that the greatest sin one can commit is to think that they are weak. He believed that we all have the potential to be great and that we should not limit ourselves by thinking that we are not capable of achieving our goals. He encouraged people to believe in their abilities and to strive to achieve greatness.So Jaypee debsoc wishes the youth to work on themselves and become the beacon of hope to tje masses so that youth can be the change we need in today's time.

The Jaypee Debsoc X Parola  in collaboration with The Intellectual Property Cell (IPR) on 18th of November successfully conducted a great *TURNCOAT DEBATE*, a much anticipated event where the participants showcased the power of the words and plethora of their knowledge. On November 11, the Jaypee Debsoc in collaboration with NSS, and IIC conducted a debate competition in honour of National Education Day. The Jaypee Debsoc took part in the celebration of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad's birth anniversary, India's first education minister after independence. The event saw participation from volunteers who debated on the common motion for the debate which was “Deliberation on the new education policy 2020”.The debate was judged by the faculty coordinators of the Jaypee Debsoc,NSS and IIC.The opening speech was given by Ashwini sir emphasizing on the national education day. All the participants had done extensive research on the topic which was evident from their thoughtful and unique speeches.Results were announced which were as follows:-First position: Kunal SinghSecond position: Sanajana Sharma  Ananny TripathiThird Position: Neha MittalThe faculty coordinators congratulated the winners and gave them their winning certificates.

We were just in time to introduce our first debating format, The Asian Parliamentary Debate. APD format though extensive, is a very thought after debating style, which comprises of 2 bodies, “Government” and “ Opposition” debating head strong. During this session, we explained the framework of APD and the various speaking roles. After this detailed discussion, first years were assigned the topic, "This House believes that the Internet should be regulated just like all other media." to deliberate upon. To our surprise, both teams presented arguments keeping in mind the complete format, and flow of debate. We as a team are in for a great ride, debates like this are only just the beginning!

In the past weeks, The Jaypee Debsoc have had incredible session with first years. It first started with a lively introduction during which everyone of our new members came forward and introduced themselves. They were interrogated by the seniors with much intriguing questions.  The introduction was followed by our first Group Discussion (GD) on the subject of "Would India become the biggest economy in the next debate in terms of GDP?" All of them present astounding fascinating perspectives and ideas that would cause anyone to consider. We are proud to say, we have such intellectual and keen learners in the society. With such members, The Jaypee Debsoc would reach even greater heights!

The Jaypee Debsoc presents the Personality of the Week, Khabane Lame a.k.a Khaby Lame. A person whose silence speaks volumes, became the most followed TikToker in June 2022.Contrary to the popular 'trying too hard' behaviour that has taken over present day pop culture, his authenticity is quite appealing and debunks or mocks the overproduced trends that happen across social media.In August 2021, Lame appeared as a co-star for Juventus F.C.'s announcement of Manuel Locatelli. His exasperation is quite universal and emotions are relatable. His skyrocketing to stardom shone an unfavourable spotlight on Italy’s very strict citizenship rules. He represents the idea that hard work and determination gets you far in life. Even though he got layed off during the pandemic cutoffs, he didn't give up and continued making tiktok videos which later became a global sensation. Subsequently he was granted with Italian citizenship in August 2022.Kudos to him on his hard work, determination and go getting attitude 👏

“The great thing in this world is not so much where you stand, as in what direction you are moving.” -Oliver Wendell HolmesThe Jaypee Debsoc presents The Personality of the Week, Councillor Mohinder K Midha.The dedicated and inspiring Indian-Origin Politician from the UK’s Opposition Labour Party wrote history after becoming the first Dalit woman mayor in the United Kingdom. She has been elected mayor of the Ealing Council in West London. A part of the manifesto that she campaigned on for the election stated that if elected she will handle issues like cost of living, post-pandemic recovery, violent crimes and anti-social behavior. Her role includes initiating policy, making decisions and implementing it, being a spokesperson of the council, sharing collective decision making responsibility and developing partnerships in the borough.

Do you'll know about Roe v Wade or what's happening in the US regarding abortion Rights?No? Worry not!“DebSoc Summarise” is here to make you understand this.We at The Jaypee DebSoc are not only spreading awareness about women empowerment and helping you sail through your inhibitions, but we also have an ongoing campaign for women's safety and their empowerment. We are always ready to celebrate women and their achievements.So, keep watching to understand more about the debate around pro-rights and pro-life movements. Stay tuned!

“Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —George AddairThe Jaypee Debsoc presents The Personality of the Week, Droupadi Murmu.The inspiration serves and enlightens the path of the fearless and empowering leaders. From motivating a tribe to encouraging the whole nation our 15th President, Droupadi Murmu has become the first tribal and the second woman to become the President of India. She was born in Uparbeda village of Mayurbhanj district in Odisha in a Santali tribal family to Biranchi Narayan Tudu. In 2007, she received the Nilkantha Award for the best MLA ( Member of Legislative Assembly) by Odisha Legislative Assembly. Later, she became the first woman Governor of Jharkhand. Jai Hind! 🇮🇳

“There’s no shortage of remarkable ideas, what’s missing is the will to execute them.” – Seth GodinThe Jaypee Debsoc presents The Personality of the Week, Ramkrishna Mukkavilli.Ramkrishna Mukkavilli has become the first Indian to be recognised as the Global Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) Pioneer for water stewardship by the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC). He is the founder and the Managing Director of Maithri Aquatech, a Make-in-India company. He has been recognised for his work in building water security with nature-based water solutions across India and 27 countries spanning the Middle East, South East Asia, and Africa. His company’s unique solution- Meghdoot, is based on an alternative water concept which is known as AIR, which contains six times as much fresh water as all the rivers on the planet combined.To date, Maithri Aquatech has generated over 100 million litres of fresh water from the air and has saved an estimated 200 million litres of crucial groundwater resources from exploitation. He is an inspiring businesman who never failed to love the nature and contribute for the cause and bring change.

As a debating society, we help encourage our generation to be informed, opinionated and assertive. To help reach this milestone, The Jaypee Debsoc presents its very own News Channel “DebSoc Summarise“ -built only to help you develop a better understanding of what is going around you. Pilot: The Agnipath Scheme Launched by The Government of India, the Agnipath Scheme allows the recruitment of candidates into the Indian Armed Forces for four years. In this video, we aim to answer all your questions, and provide solid facts that will help you understand this initiative better.

“Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.” - Napoleon HillThe Jaypee Debsoc presents The Personality of the Week, Joyita Mondal, an inspiration and the symbol of pride and courage.Joyita Mondal is India’s first transwoman to be on a judicial panel of a civil court. She suffered a harsh fate, spent several sleepless nights on an empty stomach. She had to sleep on bus stands and beg on streets, but showed resilience and later became the first trans person from her district to get a voter ID. She also raised awareness and helped trans people and sex workers in getting their fundamental rights and inspired many. She gained respect due to her passion, dedication and nobel work. In 2017, her hardwork paid off when she was appointed as a judge in the Lok Adalat in West Bengal at the age of 29.Stay tuned and follow our page, where we will pay tribute and honor such inspiring personalities and their journeys every week.

Pride Month is a time to celebrate the progress that has been made by the LGBTQIA+ community, while also recognizing that there is still much work to be done. As we reflect on the progress that has been made, it is important to remember the voices of those who have fought for this equality. Everyone deserves to celebrate who they are, who they love and what they do. Let's celebrate this pride month and the whole LGBTQIA+ community by spreading the love and knowledge. The Jaypee debsoc is a space of inclusivity that aims to create a safer and holistic environment for people belonging to every gender, sexuality and different backgrounds. To celebrate the spirit of Pride, The Jaypee Debsoc pays tribute and salutes the indomitable spirit of LGBTQIA+ activists across the globe.

Philosophies are a powerful tool that can be used to easily overpower your opponents in a debate. It is important to know how to chose the right philosophy to execute the perfect offense and the knowledge of philosophy helps build a solid defense against your opposition. In our day-to-day life it gives us an insight in the root causes for thoughts thus giving us the upper hand in handling situations. We will dive-in in various philosophies and by the end of the session you will be able to become a stoic, a nihilist, a hedonist etc at will. So join us and gain one of the most potent tools to win debates and defend debates. Date- 6th May 2022Venue- G7Time- 5pm Don't be late!!!!

East or west? Mountains or beaches? Tom&Jerry or Friends? 𝗖𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗺 𝗼𝗿 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗺? “As a singer, you have to bring the soul to the song.”These words were quoted and proved true by one of the few legendary artists that forever changed the course of Indian Music Industry.Lata Mangeshkar was one of the greatest singers in the nation. She not only created a name for herself in Hindi, but she also recorded songs in over 36 Indian languages.Before mesmerizing the whole nation with her beautiful voice, the Nightingale of India had to come a long way and face many rejections, with some music directors even remarking her voice as "too thin". They had no idea that this "too thin" voice would cause people to experience feelings they had never experienced before. After her father's death, Lata Mangeshkar was mentored by Ghulam Haider, who believed in her talent and singing. According to Lata, Haider showed complete faith in her talent. She even considered him as her Godfather.Apart from providing the people with masterpieces in the entertainment media, she brought the nation to tears, including the prime minister after singing the song "Aye Mere Watan Ke Logo" against the backdrop of Sino-Indian War in 1963. In 1974, she became the first Indian to perform at Royal Albert Hall, London. She has received numerous honours, including the Padma Bhushan, Dadasaheb Phalke Award, Padma Vibhushan, and Bharat Ratna.Even the Late Dilip Kumar once commented "Lata Mangeshkar ki awaaz kudrat ki takhleek ka ek karishma hain" that translates to "Lata Mangeshkar's voice is a miracle from God". Following all, Dilip Kumar was indeed correct about her, as the entire world mourns the loss of such a magnificent talented soul after her untimely death. May her soul rest in peace.By- Anujesh Bansal

The Jaypee Debsoc celebrates Parakram Diwas on his 125th Birth Anniversary of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose.  He was no ordinary man. The only reason why the British had to leave India, as confessed by British PM Atlee to JusticePB Chakraborty at the Raj Bhawan in 1956. At that time, Justice Chakraborty, who was then the acting Governor of Bengal, had a prolonged discussion regarding the fundamental factors that had led the British to quit India. We want to quote their conversation here as told by Justice Chakraborty, who had written a letter to the publisher of RC Majumdar's book, A History of Bengal, in which he wrote:"My direct question to Attlee was that since Gandhi's Quit India Movement had tapered off quite some time ago and in 1947 no such new compelling situation had arisen that would necessitate a hasty British departure, why did they have to leave?In his reply, Attlee cited several reasons, the main among them being the erosion of loyalty to the British crown among the Indian Army and Navy personnel as a result of the military activities of Netaji.No words or paragraphs can describe the work and contribution of Netaji Bose in our freedom struggle.

Very few nations and times have seen the likes of leaders like the 11th Prime Minster of India, Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ji. Born in 1924 in Gwalior, he was a member of the Indian Parliament for over five decades, having been elected to Lok Sabha a total of 10 times and also to Rajya Sabha twice. He steered India through the rough coalition years of the Indian democracy and served as the PM not only once, but first for a period of 13 days, then 13 months, finally followed by a full five-year term. Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee is known today for the Pokhran II nuclear tests which made India a full-fledged nuclear power and the glorious victory in the Kargil War of 1999. But very few people know that he was also a poet and a scholar. His speech possessed such articulation skills that even opposition leaders couldn’t help but toe their own party lines to support him. He was a true patriot and reformer and dreamt of a shining India, a dream shared by million others. Sri Atal Bihari Vajpayee has left an indelible mark on Indian politics, and the ideals that he stood for and the principles he upheld still continue to inspire us.

Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel participated in many agitations after Satyagraha.. And this brought his closer to Gandhi. Sardar Vallabhai Patel contributed in many ways during the freedom struggle. For his active participation, he was jailed several times. Even if he was jailed many times, it didn't dissuade him from his motive. Patel's primary motivation was to expel the British out of the country. His patriotism for the country was strong and fierce. Sardar Vallabhai Patel was an independent and motivated man. He completed all his professional endeavors with close to no help from other people. Sardar Vallabhai Patel was one of the people who contributed to bringing the people of the country together. He empowered people to fight against the British authorities. The Iron Man of India is a freedom fighter of the country. He was a part of many protests against the authorities in India. Patel joined Mahatma Gandhi in the Satyagraha in Gujarat and became a part of the Quit India Movement. He joined the Indian National Congress and became of the vital party members of the party. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel inspired the people of the country in many ways. He was a self-made man because he didn't depend on anyone for any reason. Patel was one of the most beloved leaders of the country because he connected with the people. He brought the people of the country together. After Independence his role in the Indian political front increased. He was elected as the Home Minister of India, and later, he was elected as the Deputy Prime Minister of India. He became the first person to be selected for both positions. He played a significant role in bringing the country together. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was the main force who integrated the states of India. He was a firm believer in the One Nation Theory, which resulted in the formation of India's rules.

𝘋𝘪𝘴𝘤𝘪𝘱𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘭 𝘴𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘤𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘨𝘵𝘩 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯A reformer, a scholar and a true stalwart of Indian Independence, Shri Lal Bahadur Shastri has left a legacy that is hard to top. Born in a humble family on October 2, 1904, he was a man of principles and always righteous in his cause. Due to his dedication to the nation, he quickly rose to high positions of power and held various ministries before finally becoming the second Prime Minister of India in 1964.Shastri’s thoughts were greatly inspired by Swami Vivekananda and he was a staunch patriot who knew the soul of India inside-out. _“Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan”_, the slogan he gave very accurately sums up his legacy. He promoted the green revolution, the white revolution and guided India to a proud victory in the Indo-Pakistan War of 1965.

The Jaypee Debsoc celebrates the 75th anniversary of The United Nations thereby reaffirming our commitment to the ideals of the UN.On October 24, 1945, 51 countries came together to create the United Nations. Its purpose was to promote peace and cooperation around the world. Today the United Nations is an organization made up of 193 countries. In every corner of the world, the United Nations is a living testament of hope.

75 year on, India remains committed to principal of United Nations and is proud to make significant contribution in implementing goals of UN charter and evolution of UN's specialised programs and agencies.Pandemic has given us opportunity to build better post covid world.Today, the milestone anniversary of UN charter is occasion to introspect and see where we can enhance our focus to make Earth a better place to live.#un75 🌍🇮🇳🇺🇳video credit - @indiaatun

India celebrates National Solidarity Day on 20th October every year.It was the day when our northern neighbour who was a friend to us, propelled a sudden  attack on our territory which continued for about a month ending in November,1962 .The purpose of the day is to celebrate the memory of solidarity, unity, and integrity of our people during the war in order to protect the nation. Therefore, the recognition of National Solidarity Day is a yearly token of the central solidarity and greeting of love, gratitude, and respect for our Armed Forces. Also, the entire country recalls those soldiers who sacrificed their lives for the nation.#nationalsolidarityday #indianarmy #armedforces

2020 Theme: Acting together to achieve social and environmental justice for all The theme for the Day this year addresses the challenge of achieving social and environmental justice for all. The growing recognition of the multi-dimensionality of poverty means that these two issues are inseparably intertwined, and that social justice cannot be fully realized without aggressively rectifying environmental injustices at the same time. We at The Jaypee Debsoc support the initiative #endpoverty and believe that poverty can be eradicated by collective action of everyone.#endpoverty #internationaldayfortheeradicationofpoverty

Welcome to the official page of The Jaypee Debsoc, we as a society aim to develop qualities of diligence, commitment and team spirit in our members. Debsoc takes pride in producing quality debaters who have won various national MUNs, PDs and CDs.

crescendojiit.caption: Andholika – Western Solo Singing"Love, loss, and everything in between."Representing Crescendo at OASIS'24, BITS Pilani, Kishlay Gupta delivered a soulful rendition of All of Me by John Legend in the Andholika Western solo singing competition. With heartfelt emotion and smooth finesse, he captured the essence of the song’s timeless lyrics, resonating deeply with the crowd and earning a well-deserved ✨2nd place.✨ We’re incredibly proud of Kishlay for pouring his heart into this performance and showcasing Crescendo's talent with such passion (all while wearing shorts).#AllOfMe #johnlegend #crescendo #WesternVocals #BITS24 #oasis24

Pitch Perfect – Acapella Competition"Daft Punk, Crescendo-style!"The JIIT Western Choir took OASIS'24 by storm at Pitch Perfect with an acapella medley that paid tribute to Daft Punk. Their set included iconic hits like Technologic, One More Time, Get Lucky, and Digital Love, all brought to life through rich harmonies and pure vocal talent. The energetic, flawless performance earned our choir ✨ 2nd place!✨ Huge kudos to them for lighting up the stage and bringing the Crescendo spirit to life! #PitchPerfect #DaftPunkMedley #Crescendo#oasis24 #BITS24 #acapella #getlucky

Tarang – Battle of Bands"When genres collide, magic happens!"Our college band, DEADW!NG, represented Crescendo with power and style at OASIS, BITS Pilani! In Tarang, they rocked the stage with two distinct songs: the intricate jazz-rock of Mr. Invisible by Thank You Scientist and the electrifying intensity of Shiva by Thaikkudam Bridge. Their standout performance secured them an incredible  ✨ 3rd position! ✨#jiit #battleofbands #oasis24 #bits #crescendo #music

Throwback to an incredible day at Rendezvous, IIT Delhi!! Our talented musicians from Crescendo gave it their all in the competitions, representing our college with passion and skill. From the mesmerizing flute and keyboard duo to a soulful solo western performance, and an electrifying western choir, it was an unforgettable experience. Proud of all our participants for putting on a great show, regardless of the results. The journey is just as important as the destination, and we're excited for what’s next! 🎤🎹🎼

Hey Freshers!!!!We’ve already seen some amazing performances from you, and now it’s time to take things up a notch. This isn’t just an introduction – it’s your chance to see why joining CRESCENDO will be the best part of your college journey. Whether you’ve already performed on our stage or are just getting started, this orientation is where you’ll get a sneak peek into what’s in store.From being a part of major competitions to organizing some of the most exciting events on campus, Crescendo offers endless opportunities to grow, perform, and make unforgettable memories. We’ll break the ice, and show you exactly why THIS HUB is the place to be. 📅 Date: 14th September ⏰ Time: 1:00 PM onwards 📍 Venue: LT1 We want YOU to take the stage with us!

🎶 Calling All Second-Year Music Enthusiasts! 🎶Are you passionate about music and eager to make your mark in Crescendo? We are looking for dedicated volunteers for the year 2024-25! If you’re ready to contribute, learn, and be a part of our vibrant community, fill out the Google form in our bio.Don’t miss this chance to join the hub and create unforgettable musical experiences together!

Meet Kunal Kishore, our former Management Head and a true cornerstone of our music society. As a talented guitarist and vocalist, Kunal has always been the driving force behind our events, ensuring everything runs smoothly. His dedication and leadership have been instrumental in shaping our society’s success, making him an invaluable asset to our team. We are thrilled to have Kunal as a Senior Advisor this year, continuing to guide us with his expertise and passion for music.

Say hello to Prerit Sharma, our former Marketing Head, who excelled in managing events with finesse. As a vocalist, Prerit’s dynamic presence brought energy and enthusiasm to our society. His adept handling of public relations and events made him an indispensable part of our team. We are delighted to have Prerit as a Senior Advisor this year, bringing his expertise and vibrant spirit to guide us forward.

Introducing Mihika Manuraj, our previous Administrative Head, whose soothing voice has enchanted us all. As a vocalist, Mihika’s calming presence was matched by her friendly demeanor, making her a beloved figure among her juniors. Her unwavering support and kindness have left a lasting impact, creating a nurturing environment within our society. We are excited to have Mihika as a Senior Advisor this year, continuing to inspire and support us with her warmth and experience.

Introducing Shambhavi Swaroop The PR Head Of Crescendo. She’s a music enthusiast with a soulful journey. Growing up, music was her solace, her confidant, and her driving force. From singing in the shower to performing on stage, her passion for music has only intensified with time. She’s explored various styles and genres, shaping her unique sound. Her musical journey has been a rollercoaster of creativity, self-expression, and personal growth. She’s grateful for the melodies that have filled her life with joy, comfort, and purpose. Music is her language, her escape, and her legacy.

Meet Shubhashri! A dazzling mezzo-soprano singer, who kicked off her musical journey with Rabindra Sangeet at the age of 4. With a boundless passion for both Indian and Western music, she’s a musical chameleon who can effortlessly switch genres. An artist and dancer too, she’s a whirlwind of creativity and charisma.Shubhashri’s friendly nature and gift of gab make her a magnet for connections, and her radiant smile is the secret ingredient to her comforting, captivating presence. Whether she’s belting out a melody or working the room, her infectious energy and networking prowess are simply unmatched!

“Meet Sushweta, often known as sushy. Ten years ago, she started her musical adventure with classical tunes. Along the way, she had her fair share of ‘oops’ moments, but she didn’t fret (pun intended). She took them in stride and learned from them. Whether she’s strumming a guitar or tinkling the piano keys, Sushweta’s musical journey keeps hitting all the right notes – and a few puns!” 🎵✨(Note: She can yap about Hozier for hours, so be prepared for a lyrical lecture!)

Sreya Varghese is a passionate singer who fills her free time with the joy of exploring new songs and travelling to new places. Her hobbies include singing, listening to music, and engaging in spirited debates. Her love for music extends beyond performing, as she immerses herself in diverse genres, constantly discovering fresh melodies. Her adventures in travel enrich her life with unique experiences and cultural insights. With a vibrant personality and a heart full of melodies, Sreya’s journey through life is a harmonious blend of passion and adventure.

Meet Swastik. He is a multi-instrumentalist specializing in the flute, deeply connected to Lord Krishna, which is why the flute holds a special place in his heart. Music has always been an integral part of his life, serving as a source of inspiration and expression. Swastik’s passion for music extends beyond personal enjoyment; he thrives in team environments, where his collaborative spirit and ability to interact seamlessly with others shine. Whether performing on stage, coordinating events, or simply jamming with friends, Swastik brings harmony and enthusiasm to every endeavor. His dedication to music and teamwork reflects his commitment to creating meaningful and memorable experiences for everyone around him.

“Introducing Srivas Sundar, management lead at Crescendo: A talented vocalist and guitarist, he is deeply passionate about music. Known for his strong organizational skills, he excels in teamwork, exudes optimism, and performs with unwavering confidence.”

Meet Aryan, a dynamic drummer who started his musical journey at just 8 years old. Famous for his innovative shift from 4/4 to 3/4 beats during performances, Aryan never fails to surprise his audience. When he’s not behind his drum kit,you’ll find him dominating in Valorant or or exploring new anime series. Known for his friendliness and willingness to help others, Aryan boasts a playlist as diverse as his interests, filled with songs from various genres and languages. A true cinephile, Aryan’s enthusiasm for movies knows no bounds, constantly on the lookout for the next great film to dive into. ; )

Meet Gaurav, a cool dude. Always giving obscure movie recommendations. Has an almost predatory gaze while singing but is really just having trouble remembering the lyrics. When he sings though, his passion shines through. Picture him rocking out on stage with a killer performance, belting out those hard-hitting notes, even as he wrestles with the lyrics. Now that’s cool.

Meet Hitendra. Always fascinated with the guitar, he’s a self-taught guitarist and passionate about using music as his form of expression. From an awestruck child watching performances to giving them in college, he’s grateful for every opportunity. Hitendra’s music taste spans metal, rock, hip-hop, indie, and soft Bollywood, with a deeper love for indie and metal. He jokingly gatekeeps his favorite songs, so if he shares them with you, consider yourself as a bestie ;) For him, listening to music is a ritual, not a hobby. When “unemployed” (his term for free time), he’s either watching anime (ready to debate on a cliff’s edge) or playing lawn tennis. A social being, Hitendra loves interacting with others, always bringing a fun and smooth vibe to every conversation (+1000 aura)

Introducing Varun, with a voice that heals and a soul that sings. Varun isn’t just passionate about music—he’s a composer of melodies that stir the soul and a lyricist weaving stories that resonate deeply.Music isn’t just his passion; it’s his heartbeat. When he’s not captivating listeners with his voice, you’ll often find him turning everyday moments with his infectious Punjabi vibes!

Meet Shrankhala, a music enthusiast whose love affair with the guitar started in childhood and has been going strong ever since. For Shrankhala, the guitar isn’t just a bunch of strings and wood—it’s her trusty sidekick, helping her express feelings that even her best friends don’t always get. She’s dived headfirst into Hindustani music, becoming a true aficionado, and she’s the kind of musician who finds joy and fulfillment in jamming with bands and orchestras. When she’s not strumming away or dazzling audiences, you’ll find her geeking out over anime and exploring every music genre under the sun. Oh, and if you ever hear someone singing like they’re auditioning for a pop concert while playing guitar, that’s probably Shrankhala—because why settle for just one talent when you can serenade the world with both?

Abhinav is a passionate music producer and a multi-instrumentalist with an excellency in playing the keys. Being an avid Jazz, Mathrock, Hip-Hop, and EDM enjoyer, he’s knowledgeable and can riff on just about anything. Only blues he has in his life is the scale. As skillful as he is, also a fun guy when you get along. “Yo, can you clap to this?? *plays a 15/16 riff*”

Formed in 2016, this Haryana-based indie rock band has garnered immense popularity in quite a short span of time. Not fencing around one particular genre, the band for its cause of reaching out individualistically opens its brackets for Rock, Pop, Funk and Indian Classical. It plays in a broader spectrum and focuses on bringing in ambirnt tones and soulful feeling and not just technique. The band has also shone in various music fests and are a favorite for private gigs, university and college fests, cultural events, weddings, and so on. Check out their songs like ‘Main Zinda Hoon’, ‘Marne Ki Aadatein’, and ‘Mahakaal Aa Raha’ to experience the magic they weave through music yourself.........#ArtistOfTheWeek#music #indie #bands #wcmt #indianbands #acoustic #independent #artists #musicians #indiemusic #guitar #vocals #newmusic #artistsofindia #indiesounds #sounds #livemusic #underrated

Hey guys!! Impressions 2020 is almost here, Crescendo- the music hub of JIIT is glad to announce the most awaited event "Voice of Impressions". VOI gives a platform to all the melodious singers to showcase their talent.The online round is officially open!! .Rules:1. The first round i.e the online round of the contest starts from this moment onwards and will be open until 20th February, Thursday, 11:59 pm. The participants need to send their video which will be uploaded on the Facebook and Instagram page of Crescendo. The videos with maximum likes/shares/comments will be considered for the next round. Any video or likes/shares/comments on the video will not be considered after the said date. Postponement of this round beyond the last day, if any, will be notified on the page accordingly.2. Participants can send their videos to one of these WhatsApp numbers 7004557966 or 8527367484 along with the following information:a.) Nameb.) Name of Collegec.) Year (1st, 2nd etc.)d.) Contact Numbere.) Email ID3. The time limit of the video is 1 minute 30 seconds, and the size must not exceed 30 MB. Videos failing to comply with these limits shall not be entertained. 4. The following are the acceptable cases for both the rounds:a.) Vocalist only (No background music)b.) Vocalist with an instrumentc.) Vocalist with an accompanying instrumentalistd.) Vocalist with karaokeThere cannot be two instruments involved.5. The singer's face should be visible during the video, and the corresponding audio should be clear. Videos with edited audios will not be entertained. Use of any kind of third party apps to increase the number of likes/shares/comments will result in disqualification. 6. Likes/comments/shares will only be counted if the person liking the video has also liked the Facebook page and  followed the Instagram page of Crescendo.7. Participation from other colleges is allowed. So singers, warm up your pipes and send in your entries! We are waiting!

Hello everyone!!! With the fest around the corner, Crescendo brings you the Voice of Impressions-a stage to showcase your singing talent to the world.The online round is officially open! Get ready to take part in one of the grandest events of Impressions 2K19!Rules:1. The first round i.e the online round of the contest starts from this moment onwards and will be open until 18 February, Monday, 11:59 pm. The participants need to send their video which will be uploaded on the Facebook page of Crescendo. The videos with maximum likes/shares/comments will be considered for the next round. Any video or likes/shares/comments on the video will not be considered after the said date. Postponement of this round beyond the last day, if any, will be notified on the page accordingly.2. Participants can send their videos to one of these WhatsApp numbers 8130745989 or 8447705584 along with the following information:a.) Nameb.) Name of Collegec.) Year (1st, 2nd etc.)d.) Contact Numbere.) Email ID3. The time limit of the video is 1 minute 30 seconds, and the size must not exceed 30 MB. Videos failing to comply with these limits shall not be entertained. 4. The following are the acceptable cases for both the rounds:a.) Vocalist only (No background music)b.) Vocalist with an instrument.c.) Vocalist with an accompanying instrumentalist. There cannot be two instruments involved.5. The singer's face should be visible during the video, and the corresponding audio should be clear. Videos with edited audios will not be entertained. Use of any kind of third party apps to increase the number of likes/shares/comments will result in disqualification. 6. Likes/comments/shares will only be counted if the person liking the video has also liked the page.7. Participation from other colleges is allowed. So singers, warm up your pipes and send in your entries! We are waiting!

Proudly signing off with gratitude (and a tinge of nostalgia) ❤️GDSC JIIT had a memorable run this year, its immense success attributed to the wonderful core team. Under the leadership of @paakhim10 🚀, facilitated by @aryaman__gupta, @iamsochirag, @harsh_1503_, @dhimanshu_02, @kaavyabaranwal, Ayush Gupta, @kukreja.devansh, @siddanth._.reddy, @ag_0080, and @bohomurphy in the technical team 👾, Tanish Goyal, @astha._.r, Ayush Gupta, @manas__2709, and @ilavanyajain in the management team 👥, and @simmran_agarwal, @bohomurphy, @manas__2709, and Tanya Singh in the creative team 👩🏻‍💻, GDSC brought together over a thousand students in its hackathons, workshops, and sessions, cultivating a culture of learning, coding, and development.With a heart full of pride, we look forward to even greater achievements in the coming year! 🎉

This past year at GDSC JIIT has been nothing short of phenomenal! 🥳Our journey began with a bang 💥 – the Internal Hackathon for SIH '23 in September! With a record-breaking 700+ registrations, this hackathon marked a new chapter in GDSC JIIT history. 🏆 With a goal of continued learning, we hosted the Cloud Study Jams 👾 in October, where our dedication earned us the prestigious Bronze Tier achievement. December saw the Android Development Camp take center stage, conducted entirely online with numerous enthusiastic participants joining both days. ‍ Then came the much-awaited Impressions 2024 in February, a whirlwind of exciting events. With Codecharades 🎭 on Day 1 and Chords & Clues 🎶 on Day 2, we saw a combined participation of over 180 JIITians eager to test their skills on our carefully crafted challenges. March and April witnessed our flagship event: Aspire 🚀. The Aspire Info Session was held in person in March with a remarkable turnout. We delved into exciting fields like blockchain, AI/ML, data science, and web development, and even launched the GoogleVerse segment! The momentum continued with the Aspire Hands-on Workshops in April, focusing on Data Science/ML and Web Dev. With over 100 participants attending in person, these workshops empowered students to gain practical experience. ‍👩🏻‍💻 As we wrapped up the year in May, we proudly facilitated the Gen AI Study Jams, achieving the coveted Gold Tier 🥇. This accomplishment reflects our unwavering commitment to fostering a vibrant learning environment in our campus. The 2023-24 tenure for GDSC set numerous landmarks and brought forth new ideas — whether that be GoogleVerse in Aspire, the twist of bhailang in Codecharades, the use of Gemini in Chords & Clues, or the reels we launched in promotion of our events. We can't wait to see what the next year brings for GDSC! 🥳🚀

The 2022-23 term for GDSC JIIT was an exhilarating journey filled with innovation, teamwork, and growth!🎉 Having started with the Compose Camp in October, we successfully organized Hackin' Winters ❄️ with over 100 participants in November along with advanced workshops on various technical themes. We held the reputed ASPIRE program in the same month, which gathered hundreds of curious minds to kick off their journey in tech. The next semester was equally productive for the club. We conducted the Web Portfolio building in HTML & CSS for aspiring students in February and the Flutter Forward Extended program where we guided students in Flutter and Firebase in March. Along with that, we campaigned for the famous Google Cloud Career Practitioner program that got numerous students official Google swags 🤩.Then came Impressions 2023 👾. While all of the core team at GDSC was excited to get their annual fest back, we knew we had a great opportunity to organize fun and innovative events for the students. Despite simultaneous non-technical events, CSS Smackdown and Bake A Cake were two of our most fascinating events that invited hundreds of participants to try their hands at web development and cryptography.As we wrap up this term, here is a massive shoutout to our core team for making every event and campaign an unforgettable success! 🌟Our hearts brim with excitement and curiosity as we kick off the new term! Stay tuned for even more fun and innovation!🚀🎉#gdscjiit #developerstudentclubs  @googlefordevs #googledeveloperstudentclubs @jiit.official

Hope you’re doing well. Last year brought many challenges, but it also brought the drive to help each other and give back to our communities. With that in mind, Google is inviting university students to join the Google Developers Student Clubs 2021 Solution Challenge!The mission of the challenge is to solve for one or more of the United Nations' 17 Sustainable Development Goals using Google technology. Submissions will be accepted up until March 31, 2021. Register here : https://developers.google.com/community/gdsc-solution-challengeFinalists and top winners receive: - Customized mentorship from Google Developers - Chromebook- 1-year subscription to PluralsightSwag and more! Resources available from Google:- Live virtual sessions and Q&A- Mentorship- Custom codelabs, training videos and more!#google  #technology #students #sustainabledevelopment #unitednations

"The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world’s problems." - Mahatma Gandhi Today we remember Mahatma Gandhi, fondly referred as "Bapu" on his birth anniversary as chief architect of India's freedom struggle. He not only served as a true source of hope and a harbinger of peace for the distressed masses but also embodied unwavering determination, exemplified by the Dandi March. Gandhiji's philosophy of Satyagraha was the soul of India's conquest for freedom and Achieving his vision of self sufficiency and sustainability will be the honest tribute to his legacy. We, at The Page Turner Society extend warm greetings on occasion of Gandhi Jayanti#pts #GandhiJayanti

मन्नाथः श्रीजगन्नाथः मद्गुरुः श्रीजगद्गुरुः। मदात्मा सर्वभूतात्मा तस्मै श्रीगुरुवे नमः।। 'Salutation to the noble Guru, who is my Lord and the Lord of the Universe, my Teacher of the Universe, who is the Self in me and the Self in all beings.'On this Teacher's Day, we celebrate the birth anniversary of Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan. His decision to commemorate his birthday as a day to honor teachers reflects the profound respect and regard he held for educators. His legacy reminds us of the pivotal role teachers play in shaping our minds ,the character and future of our nation. Not only a teacher shape our mind but today's modern literature like the movies(Taare Zameen Par, Harry Potter,3 idiots etc.) and the actors who play such roles from our own life can be a great medium to learn different outlooks, aspects ,ethics and morals to pursue in our journey of  life.Therefore, let's express our gratitude to all our dedicated teachers. Happy Teacher's Day!❤️#pts #teacher #teachersday

The splendour of colours in the air brings forth the advent of Spring, and a chance to start over again, forgetting past animosities. The festival of Holi is celebrated all across the country in all its diverse and grand forms - from Latmar Holi in Uttar Pradesh to Ukuli in Kerala. With origins deeply rooted in Hindu mythology, Holi symbolises the downfall of evil - the triumph of Lord Vishnu over the demon king Hiranyakashyapa. It also reminds us of the eternal love between Lord Krishna and Radha. The PageTurner Society wishes you and your loved ones, a delightful and vibrant Holi. May your life be full of colours - red mirroring love, yellow representing knowledge, green bringing all the new beginnings, and blue giving you eternity.#Holi2023 #Holi #festival #colors #beginnings #spring #march #fyp

With all the lights and Diyas eradicating darkness, and all the prayers and love among people creating a wonderful atmosphere of goodness and purity, the festival of Diwali fills everyone's hearts with an aura of purity and a happy and compassionate mood."Diwali" also known as festival of lights, is a festival of celebrating victory of goodness over darkness and lord Rama's triumphant return to his home after an exile of 14 years, an opportunity to spruce up the home, buy new clothes, and ofcourse enjoying parties, feasting and enjoying gifts and sweets. On this night, people offer prayers to the Goddess Lakshmi,the goddess of wealth and Lord Ganesha , the god representing good fortune and wisdom. "When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die. There is no middle ground."~ CerseiWhen they said "Winter is Coming", they meant it !! It indeed is coming in literal sense.This Halloween month, don't limit yourself and your spooky side and join us for a fun and interesting event, where you not only get to express your crazily chilling side but also stand a chance to win some exciting prizes. " Don’t kill, but conquer the Ravana in you.”VIijaydashami also known as  Dussehra, Dasara or Dashain, is a major Hindu festival celebrated at the end of Navaratri every year  in Nepal  and India. Vijayadashami is observed for different reasons and celebrated differently in many parts of India and Nepal. In the southern, eastern, northeastern, and some northern states of India, Vijayadashami marks the end of Durga Puja, remembering goddess Durga's victory over the buffalo demon Mahishasura to restore and protect dharma. In the northern, central and western states,  it marks the end of Ramlila and remembers god Rama's victory over Ravana. Dussehra is a time for celebration, a time for victory of good over bad, a time to get inspired by the exemplary power of good.🍁So, The Page Turner Society wishes you a very happy and prosperous Dussehra. 🍁 💫May the Victory of Good over Evil inspire you towards your victories.💫#thepageturnersociety#dussehra#goodoverevil#festival

"या देवी सर्वभूतेषु शक्ति-रूपेण संस्थिता। नमस्तस्यै नमस्तस्यै नमस्तस्यै नमो नमः॥"“The goddess who is invoked in all beings as Vishnu’s maya, we bow down to her.”Bestowed with three eyes, representing the past, present and future, Goddess Durga is the divine mother of all creations, linked with humanity for the rest of its days. Being the amalgamation of powers of the mighty three - Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, she is the one true force to put an end to all evils.She descends to Earth, donned in auspicious red, on her fierce lion, and so begin the sacred festivities to celebrate her victories over destructive monstrosities. Be it Durga Puja in the east or Navratri in the north/west, it is a glorious festival to appease Goddess Durga, which also marks the beginning of autumn in the country!The PageTurner Society wishes you a radiant Durga Puja and Navratri, hoping it brings you and your loved ones immense joy and fortune! "May Lord Ganesha bestow you power, destroy your sorrow and enhance happiness in your life."🙏🏼Pageturner Society wishes you a very happy Ganesh Chaturthi along with a good recommendation for lovers of Mythological Genre💫.Review : "Ganesha, the auspicious, the beginning by Shakunthala Jagannathan is a beautiful culmination of Lord Ganesha's legacy, history, significance, philosophy and prominence. Our generation grew up watching Ganesha in childhood movies and cartoons, and a lot of us hold him in affection. The books contains a lot of pictures of Ganesha's depictions in architecture and scriptures and it's very interesting to note just how many lives have been touched by Ganesha's legacy .The book is actually a multidimensional study of Ganesha's impact on the people, leaning it more towards sociology than religion. It's an informative book, so we wouldn't recommend it to someone looking for preaching or self help. However, those interested in reading about the history, legends and stories associated with Ganesha, along with archeological evidences of his devotees thrown in will find this book a perfect match.🙌🏼🧡#GaneshaChaturthi #Festival #LordGanesha #Books #BookReview #jiit #Pts

Jawaharlal Nehru said, “The children of today will make the India of tomorrow. The way we bring them up will determine the future of the country.”November 14 is celebrated as Children’s Day in our country, and the occasion also commemorates the birth anniversary of Jawaharlal Nehru. He generally regarded kids as the future of India and adored them so much that he was fondly called Chacha Nehru. He believed that if we want to preserve our future and make our nation more prosperous, we must focus on the education of our children as strong people and the right education build strong nations. He even used to say that the property of any nation is not in its repository but its schools. Hence we should protect the future of our country and provide them with a well-rounded education so that they can lead this country to the path of success.This is a special day that reminds us that children are the building blocks of the nation and deserve the proper education and opportunities to lead our country in the right direction and make it more prosperous.Happy Children’s Day!Caption credits: @_.pinaki

Indians all over the country come together to celebrate Govardhan Puja each year after Diwali. This day celebrates Lord Krishna’s triumph over Lord Indra. We all grew up hearing the age-old story. When Lord Krishna told the people of Mathura to worship Govardhan Hill, as it provided them and their cattle with food and resources, it angered Lord Indra. As a punishment, he made it rain for 7 days straight. To save the people, Lord Krishna raised Govardhan Parvat on his finger to provide shelter to the people. The day he dropped the mountain back after Lord Indra apologized, marks the day we all know and celebrate as Govardhan Puja. It is also called “Annakut” or the day their food bearing mountain was saved.On this day, people worship Lord Krishna, Goddess Annapurna (the goddess of food) as well as the holy cow. Traditionally, 56 types of foods are prepared this day and the gods are served first. Cows are garlanded and idols of Lord Krishna are made. People also keep pots full of different kinds of food grains.

The festival of amalgamation of all the jubilation in people's hearts is finally here.Yes Diwali is here to celebrate the homecoming of Lord Ram after defeating the evil.This festival is more than just ashes of fireworks and sweets. It symbolises the shade of luminescence in the aura of gloom with dazzling decorations of lights and colorful rangolis.So the Page Turner Society wishes you and your loved ones a safe and a very Happy Diwali.

“It all begins from an idea, goes all the way round to a plot and ends up being that one epic story.”“BOOKS” are what a closet is to the clothes, an ink is to the paper and food is to the living beings. You can travel “Around the world in eighty days” and at the same time use “The time machine” to travel back in time for seeing “The boy in the stripped pajamas” walking straight into the holocaust while reading “The diary of a young girl”. You can create a magic at “Twilight” with “Harry Potter” by your side and hear the echoing voices of the “Wuthering Heights” till the time someone observes “The catcher in the rye”. While being the “Lord of the rings” you can enjoy “The adventures of Huckleberry Finn” and at the very next moment you may also be “Gone with the wind” ~ all this while sitting in a room and reading a book in the noon.Owing to the history of books and literature and the modern day representation of fictions through digital platforms, The Pageturner society invites all the bibliophiles, readers, poets, writers and movies/series or anime lovers to it’s orientation ceremony on 4th October, 2021.Timings: 7pmVenue: Google meetCaption by: @pranavb.01

To the ones who abhor when the world goes against their favourite characters, who open up their book shelves for arranging a book into the collection and ends up reminiscing all the books and the stories related to them, who get stuck in the bookstore while admiring and reading the short summary at the back, who dream of having a large,peaceful library someday at their future home and to the ones whom we call a bibliophile or a bookworm~  we at The Page Turner Society gets you and help you find the people alike! So, if you are one of those people who feel these symptoms of a bookworm or are yet to become one then this society is surely meant for you. "श्री कृष्ण गोविन्द हरे मुरारी,हे नाथ नारायण वासुदेवा ॥"An occasion for celebrating the birth of goodness over evil - "Janmashtami" is celebrated not only in India but all over the world to rejuvenate the birth of Lord Krishna, the 8th incarnation of Lord Vishnu. It is believed that Lord Krishna was born in the era when there was darkness and evil all around. The day symbolises that one ray of hope which signifies that there can be no evil greater than the good and eventually the malignant will have to surrender on the birth of the benevolent . So, let us all burn the evil inside us at midnight and welcome the tranquillity and appearance of Lord Krishna inside us! Wishing everyone a very happy Janmashtami.

Presenting you the winner of Right Writes - May edition!हाँ, ज़िंदगी ऐसी ही होती  है... ज़िंदगी भी अजीब है कभी दीमक सी चढ़ती, तो कभी बेल सी उतरती है।पलको पर पट्टी चढ़ा कर जुगनूओं  सी चमकती हैं।कभी तन्हा कर वक्त की रेत में सुला देती हैं,कभी उम्मीद का अहसास खिला कर शोर सा जगा देती हैं।आसान होती ज़िंदगी,अगर इस दिल को फैसले लेने की ज़िद ना होती।दो रास्तों के बीच महरूम खड़े हो कर,एक डगर चुने की कशमकश ना होती।पूछता हैं सवाल यह दिल मुझसे कई मर्तबा,क्या ज़िंदगी ऐसी होती  है?शामों को ढलती, फिर रातों को जागती हैं।दिन भर के ख्यालों को संजो कर,फिर अकेलेपन में समझती हैं।कभी नादानी सी हंस देती,कभी हस्ते चेहरों में गम छिपाती हैं।यह तो बादलों से दोस्ती कर, धूप में चल जाती हैं!थोड़ी अजीब मगर, हां, ज़िंदगी ऐसी ही होती हैं।- Riyansha Malhotra (@riyansha__)#PageTurnerSociety #Books #JIIT #PTS #RightWrites #Winner #Poem #Writing #PoemWriting #competition

Ever wondered about how Afterlife looks like?Well, don't look any further if you want to experience that feeling virtually. So, today we the Page Turner Society are back with another mind-boggling and light-hearted sitcom recommendation: "The Good Place", created by Michael Schur.This bright charmer starring (Kristen Bell and Ted Danson) is enriched with philosophy, ethics and contains answers to the questions about death and life, only for your inquisitive minds.The series is stocked with a bunch of strange characters like--a selfish saleswoman, the dumb DJ, moral philosophy teacher and not to forget the sophisticated, filthy-rich philanthropist.These four misfits try to become better in the 'Jeremy Bearimy' (an Afterlife timeline) for sustaining in the good-bad place.The plot has many ups and downs and also takes some sideways turn, turning the show even more fun to watch. So, wait no more and experience the bittersweet virtual Afterlife moments displayed in the series.@nbcthegoodplace#ThePageTurnerSociety #JIIT #PTS #TheGoodPlace #series #bingewatch #hope #afterlife #jeremybearimy #Netflix #TVShow #MichaelSchur #WatchNow #GoodPlace #KristenBell #TedDanson

"The world is your oyster. It's up to you to find the pearls." As we battle against this pandemic, we all feel a bit gloomy.  In order to cheer everyone up amidst dark times, The Page Turner Society is here with a source of both entertainment and hope."The Pursuit of Happyness" is a movie with a no-hoper as it's protagonist. You feel a beam of inspiration flowing within yourself as you watch Chris Gardner struggling to make peace with the drastic changes in his life. He does not blame anyone for his difficulties. Instead, he decides to put his heart and soul into his work. You also get to witness a really strong Father and Son bond which is beyond any description. Will and Jaden Smith delivered an exceptional performance and brought the characters to life. The storyline is so engrossing, that you begin rooting for the protagonist without even realizing. Overall, the movies teaches you to dream big and never settle for mediocrity. It brings out a really deep life message, the power of hope and hardwork. So, this heartwarming and uplifting movie definitely deserves a place in your watchlist.#ThePageTurnerSociety #JIIT #PTS #Movie #ThePursuitOfHappyness #MustWatch #WillSmith #jadensmith #movietime #hollywood #MovieLove #moviereview

Once an author wrote, "People now had a ton of free time to sit and think and worry about all sorts of existential shit that they had never considered before.” and this is what is happening right now in the world. Every one of our's life has come to a standstill in this pandemic and we all are in dire need to understand how our mind is reacting to this situation. This is where our recommendation of this month comes in, The book "Everything is f*cked - A book about hope" by Mark Manson will help you understand that how one can take care of himself in these trying times.Manson has constructed this book for a reader who feels like everything in life is worthless and those who are feeling terribly helpless can start to see the meaning in life. This book takes up several examples to illustrate what is being preached by the author. Also, the book allows one to retrospect his/her actions and helps them find hope.We believe that this pandemic is pushing all of our's limits and has affected millions of people's mental health, thus it was high time we helped you all find a read that is worth your time and suitable to the situation.Hoping every single one of you is doing Fine.💫💫#ThePageTurnerSociety #Books #JIIT #PTS #hope #MarkManson #BookAboutHope #HappyReading #HappyThoughts #Reading #Retrospection

When it comes to chuckle-worthy, mildly clever, and road trip adult comedy, this is when "We're the Millers"  (starring Jennifer Aniston and Jason Sudeikis) steps in, and gives us a fun treat to our eyes.The storyline from the beginning itself is very much engaging, which involves a small-time drug dealer who smuggles a huge amount of marijuana into the US from Mexico, by hiring a fake family.En route to, Mexico the Millers come across "The Fitzgeralds", another bizarre family, and their encounter adds some humor elements to the movie. What makes the movie work is the spectacular comic timing and performances of the lead actors. What also clicks is the balance the story manages to maintain between heart-warming emotions and dirtiness. The story develops at a decent rate, with enough suspense to keep you engaged and curious. Overall, the movie is loaded with some funny snippets and gags. If you need a no-brainer to spike your mood then definitely it is worth giving a watch.#ThePageTurnerSociety #JIIT #PTS #Movie #WeAreTheMillers #jenniferaniston #jasonsudeikis #Fun #Comedy #MovieLove #movietime #MustWatch #moviereview

The world feels too depressing right now? Let us help 😎It's always hard to suggest an anime to a crowd where there are people who never have watched anything of this sort. And when it comes to comedy anime we all go to Shin-chan, one of the greatest shows (and we agree with it too 😝), but for you all, we dived a little deeper and found something that is a classic and falls in the same league. "Kochikame" is our choice for this month's anime binge.This anime will surely take us back in time and we promise it isn't going to be a scary one a beautiful one with a nostalgic touch to it. The story is about the life of a police officer Ryotsu working at a police station. The unique character selection coupled with the officers' bizarre synergy turns each episode into an intriguing and hilarious watch.So what are you waiting for? Let us live this April in Kochikame's era. See you all with the next recommendation.....#ThePageTurnerSociety #JIIT #PTS #Anime #AnimeLove #kochikame #kochikameforever #Classic #Funmy #humor #ryotsu
